Package ca.uqac.lif.cep

Elementary classes defining all the basic concepts of event stream processing.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Contextualizable  
    Pullable
    Queries events on one of a processor's outputs.
    Pushable
    Gives events to some of a processor's input.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BeepBeepUnitTest
    Parent class of all unit tests for BeepBeep and its extensions.
    Connector
    Provides a number of convenient methods for connecting the outputs of processors to the inputs of other processors.
    Connector.Variant
    Empty class representing the fact that the output type of a processor may vary
    Context
    Associative map used by processors to store persistent data
    GroupProcessor
    Encapsulates a chain of processors as if it were a single one.
    GroupProcessor.CopyCrawler
    Crawler that creates copies (clones) of whatever it encounters on its way
    GroupProcessor.ProcessorAssociation
    Tuple made of a number and a processor.
    Palette
    Provides extensions to the original parser's grammar
    Palette.PaletteEntry
    Represents one of the processors provided by this palette.
    PipeCrawler
    Visits every processor
    Processor
    Receives zero or more input events, and produces zero or more output events.
    ProcessorWrapper  
    PullableWrapper
    Wrapper around an existing Pullable with delegate methods
    PullConstant
    Returns the same event over and over when pulled
    PushableWrapper
    Wrapper around an existing Pushable with delegate methods
    SingleProcessor
    Performs a computation on input events to produce output events.
    TypedPullable<T>
    A Pullable object that casts all its output to a given type.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Pullable.NextStatus
    The "next" status of the pullable.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    Connector.ConnectorException
    Exception thrown when a problem occurs when connecting two processors
    Connector.IncompatibleTypesException
    Exception thrown when two processors with incompatible input/output types are attempted to be connected
    Connector.IndexOutOfBoundsException
    Exception thrown when the connector is asked to pipe something to a nonexistent input or output
    Connector.SelfLoopException
    Exception thrown when trying to connect the output of a processor to its own input

Package ca.uqac.lif.cep Description

Elementary classes defining all the basic concepts of event stream processing. Here are some of the important objects defined in this package.
  • A Processor is an object that takes zero or more event traces, and produces zero or more event traces as its output.
  • Pullable and Pushable are two interfaces for receiving and giving events from/to a processor, respectively.
  • Connector provides static methods for easily linking one processor's output to another's input
Author:
Sylvain Hallé
